distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for openssl-1_1 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2022-2097: Fixed partial missing encryption in AES OCB mode (bsc#1201099).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: AES OCB mode for 32-bit x86 platforms using the AES-NI assembly optimised implementation will not encrypt the entirety of the data under some circumstances. This could reveal sixteen bytes of data that was preexisting in the memory that wasn't written. In the special case of "in place" encryption, sixteen bytes of the plaintext would be revealed. Since OpenSSL does not support OCB based cipher suites for TLS and DTLS, they are both unaffected. Fixed in OpenSSL 3.0.5 (Affected 3.0.0-3.0.4). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1q (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1p).
notes.title: CVE description
